name: Mike Read Has Beautiful Breath - Illustration and Such from Popular Culture Vol. 1
description:
Mike Read Has Beautiful Breath is a collection of my illustrations deriving from popular culture. (There's a double pop culture reference in the title - brownie points to those who spot its origin/s.)

It collects various images of my various fandoms, past and present, blogged and unblogged. Through Film/TV, comics, cartoons, and video games. It also has a sketchbook section containing doodles and sketches showing the inner workings of some of the larger pieces. From Adventure Time to Zombies, and everything inbetween.

A5/Colour Throughout/28PP

name: The Grinning Man
description:
An original comic book - The Grinning Man is a ghost story about a young boy's journey through his own memory; and his mysterious encounter with the enigmatic 'grinning' man. But as the memory unfolds and the truth becomes darker - the boy is forced to realise that nothing is ever as it seems...

The Grinning Man is an attempt at revitalising the great English tradition of the Christmas Ghost Story - a tale of subtle, creeping dread read by firelight on a cold, howling night on Christmas Eve...

A4/Black and White throughout/28PP

name: Illustration Print - Hammer Horror
description:
This is a high quality print of my original 'Hammer Horror' acrylic and coloured pencil illustration. The printed image measures approx. 19 x 27cm and is surrounded with a white border of approx. 8.5mm for mounting and framing ideal for A4 size.

It is printed on 225gsm, acid free archival art paper made from 100% cotton fibres.

Prints are sent flat and unmounted but will be packaged carefully with a cardboard backing for safe transit.

name: Illustration Print - Batman
description:
This is a high quality print of my original 'Batman' acrylic and coloured pencil illustration. The printed image measures approx. 27 x 19cm and is surrounded with a white border of approx. 8.5mm for mounting and framing ideal for A4 size.

It is printed on 225gsm, acid free archival art paper made from 100% cotton fibres.

Prints are sent flat and unmounted but will be packaged carefully with a cardboard backing for safe transit.

name: Universal Horror: Icons from the Golden Age of Horror Cinema
description:
The golden age of horror cinema was alive with creeping vampires, lurching monsters and prowling werewolves; setting the windmills of our mind alight with imagination and delight.

This booklet of illustration showcases 7 monsters from the silver screen: Frankenstein's monster, The Bride, The Wolfman, Dracula, The Creature from the Black Lagoon, The Phantom of the Opera and The Mummy - both in a fully rendered form and as a series of sketches.

A4 size, 16 pages, Black and White.

The primary images can be seen in my illustration blog here:

http://stepdowninthedark.blogspot.co.uk/2011/11/horror-on-universal-scale.html

Or more images of the printed booklet can be seen here:

http://stepdowninthedark.blogspot.co.uk/2012/12/shop-down-in-dark.html
